table.name: Co-op Developer
table.place: Information Service Technology, U of M
table.description: Full stack Web Application Development (NodeJS, Angular, PHP, Jenkins Pipelines)

table.name: Business Information Technology Diploma
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Web Development, Application Development, Database Management, Network Management

table.name: Canada Life Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Twelve $2500 awards are available annually to students who will be entering their final year. Criteria include financial need and a strong academic record (minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00), as well as volunteerism/community involvement.

table.name: Applied Computer Education Leadership and Community Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: A recipient who show leadership in the College or community.  Applications must be accompanied by an essay describing (with examples) their leadership qualities in their family, College and community.

table.name: Applied Computer Education Academic Achievement Award for First-Year Students
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Recipients who have completed the first year of an Applied Computer Education diploma program, on the basis of outstanding academic achievement

table.name: RRC Students' Association International Student Scholarship
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Four scholarships of $1000 each will be awarded to international students, attending a post-secondary Red River College program on a full-time basis. The scholarships will be presented to the students who attain the highest GPA after their first term; applicants must have achieved a minimum 4.00 GPA after first term. A first term grade report should accompany the application, as well as a one-page statement outlining your experience thus far in Canada and at Red River College.

table.name: Honor Roll Certificate - Term 3
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College

table.name: Paterson GobalFoods Business Information Technology Award
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Recipients will have achieved a minimum 3.00 GPA, demonstrated volunteer activity in the community and displayed a strong work ethic in class.

table.name: Honor Roll Certificate - Term 2
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College

table.name: Applied Computer Education Research Awards
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College
table.description: Applications must be accompanied by an essay describing their research project and conclusions.   Academic achievement is also considered.

table.name: Honor Roll Certificate - Term 1
table.place: Applied Computer Education Department, Red River College

table.name: Peer Tutor
table.description: Assisting students with programming (Java, C#) and database skills to improve academic performance. Identifying and meeting the studentsâ€™ learning needs by reasoning and visualization.

table.name: Intercultural Mentorship Program
table.description: Developed a relationship with a local student to share different cultures and life perspectives. Experienced Canadian activities such as local restaurants, museums, cinemas.

table.name: Data Entry & Dish washer
table.description: Input database and made work spread sheet, washed up the dishes, distributed foods for people in need

table.name: Networking Space Host
table.description: Prepared coffee, water and popcorn ready, Answered questions and tidied up tables

table.name: Session Organizer
table.place: RRC booth at 2019 Rotary Career Symposium
table.description: Welcomed visitors and attendents, Explained Red River Collge Applied Computer Education Department Programs
